channel.title: Unexplained Mysteries
channel.description: Unexplained Mysteries examines history’s most compelling puzzles. From suspicious deaths to scientific paradoxes to paranormal reports, if there are lingering questions, Unexplained Mysteries tells the story. Every Tuesday and Thursday, we sort through the evidence—and occasionally—uncover the answers. Unexplained Mysteries is a Spotify Original from Parcast.

item.title: Introducing: Malicious Moms
item.description: Hear an exclusive clip from the first episode of Parcast Network’s newest collection, just in time for Mother’s Day. Every Sunday, see how far some women went to help their kids… and how others used motherhood to get away with their misdeeds. From college admissions scandals to “self-defense” ax murders, motherhood’s no walk in the park — and in this series, it’s a minefield. Follow Malicious Moms and listen free, only on Spotify!  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Conspiracies of the Grateful Dead Pt. 2
item.description: The Nitrous Mafia have been a fixture at Grateful Dead shows and other jam band concerts since the ‘90s. They deal nitrous oxide to fans who want a taste of euphoria, but critics claim the cutthroat racket is taking shows’ atmospheres from mellow… to menacing. This is the final episode in the special two-part series from Conspiracy Theories. Follow for new conspiracies every week! Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Conspiracies of the Grateful Dead Pt. 1
item.description: In the 1960s a counterculture revolution was upending traditional norms of life, and the Grateful Dead were providing the soundtrack… and the drugs. Of course, this put them right in the crosshairs of the FBI. But while the feds had a file on the band, did they also have a deal together? Some say the disastrous Altamont Music Festival has all the markings of sabotage… Enjoy this special two-part series from Conspiracy Theories, a Spotify Original from Parcast!  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Our Mysterious Planet: A Changing Climate
item.description: In the last episode of our four-part series, we’re examining climate change from a historical perspective — and envisioning what the world will look like if the global temperature continues to rise unchecked. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: The business of cybercrime is booming, and the people who protect our data are seemingly locked in step with the people who hack it. item.title: California’s Deadliest Wildfire
item.description: In November 2018, equipment from the largest utility company in America sparked a fire that killed 86 people and destroyed thousands of homes. item.title: The Fukushima Nuclear Disaster
item.description: In March 2011, the worst nuclear meltdown since Chernobyl took place in northern Japan. item.title: The Flint Water Crisis
item.description: An emergency plan to cut costs in Flint, Michigan resulted in a contaminated water supply for the city’s residents. The water looked, tasted, and smelled foul – because it was tainted with toxic chemicals, harmful bacteria and lead from old pipes. But government officials repeatedly dismissed the community’s concerns. What did they know about the burgeoning crisis? And how are they paying for their negligence now? item.title: New York’s Toxic Love Canal
item.description: How does a residential neighborhood get built atop a known chemical waste landfill? From the Conspiracy Theories podcast, this is the story of New York’s toxic Love Canal. What was supposed to be a suburban idyll became a dumping ground for the Hooker Electrochemical Company’s waste. When the land changed hands in the ‘50s, a school and 900 homes were constructed over an area teeming with harmful chemicals. Decades later, residents are still battling adverse health outcomes and government negligence. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
